body_html: @timmeinhardt Thank you! your comment put me on the right track. However, I think the current master branch put the created variables into the LOCAL_VARIABLES collection, so i had to initialize with tf.initialize_local_variables() as well.
body_text: @timmeinhardt Thank you! your comment put me on the right track. However, I think the current master branch put the created variables into the LOCAL_VARIABLES collection, so i had to initialize with tf.initialize_local_variables() as well.
body: @timmeinhardt Thank you! your comment put me on the right track. However, I think the current [master branch](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/71f6bb336e5e11d6da2cedac6ba1c992ad9992bd/tensorflow/python/training/input.py#L83) put the created variables into the LOCAL_VARIABLES collection, so i had to initialize with tf.initialize_local_variables() as well.
